title: Design and Effect Analysis for Improving Mathematical Problem-Solving Skills in SoTL-Based Blended Learning Environments

context.prior_knowledge: Experience in teaching mathematics (equations, functions, statistics), basic digital literacy (use of online assessment tools), and proficiency in foundational mathematical software
context.additional_context: Utilizing LMS features: video lectures (mathematical modeling cases), discussion boards (collaborative proof processes), and assignment submissions (calculation problem-solving). Learners are provided with digital tablets (equipped with graphic calculators, GeoGebra, etc.).

learning_goals: Explain three or more frameworks for teaching mathematical concepts using the SoTL (Scholarship of Teaching and Learning) approach, including formal derivation, graph interpretation, and problem-solving strategies.
Compare and analyze strategies for developing individual (computational skill enhancement) and collective (proof collaboration) expertise in blended learning environments.
Apply a five-stage system model (data collection → statistical analysis → result interpretation → strategy revision → re-evaluation) to assess the long-term effects of faculty development programs.
Propose two improvement plans linking learner feedback (error patterns in problem-solving) with institutional practices (standardized assessment systems).
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
